chapter.title: Extending PerfCake
chapter.para: PerfCake has the extension mechanism that allows user to add a server-side specific client libraries or a new functionality. The following sections describes those possibilities.

sect1.title: Client libraries
sect1.para:
Some of the PerfCake's components need additional stuff to work properly. For example:
JMS based senders need JMS provider's specific client jar files, JDBC based sender needs database specific JDBC driver.
To add the necessary client libraries and the dependencies, place it all under the $PERFCAKE_HOME/lib/ext directory.

sect1.title: Custom components
sect1.para:
PerfCake has the ability extend its functionality by adding new custom components such as senders, generators, reporters, destinations or validators.
To get the details about creating custom components, see the PerfCake Developers' Guide.
.

If you want to add a new component to be used by PerfCake, all you need to take the jar file, where the component is packaged (along with the jar files on which the component depends on), and place it all under the $PERFCAKE_HOME/lib/ext directory.
